intro: Dyssodia berlandieri, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. The plant has hairy, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to arid environments. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Dyssodia berlandieri is an important nectar source for native pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
